page.title: 12Agriculture
page.content: Norfolks soils are one of the counties most valuable resources.Agricultural output is growing.Changing agricultural practises steming from the economics of production and marketing,have caused the development of a more open type of agricultural landscape,with the removal of hedgerows and reclamation of areas of marsh and fen.Both practises are obvious in the study area.the main crops grown are Wheat,Sugar beet,and barley,in the area South to the road.To the North of the road,rough grazing land is available for dairying,most of this is on reclaimed fen.Changes in the countryside always conflict with conservation;many areas of "carrs"_stands of wood_have been removed to make way for agriculture.
